channel.title: labs on BIO 108 and 217
channel.description: Recent content in labs on BIO 108 and 217

item.title: Feb 08 Lab
item.description: Remember to bring your completed Field Trip Waiver form. You will need it to attend the lab. Plan Looking ahead, as of Tuesday (Feb 5), the forecast is for warm (and dry enough) for Friday, so it might be a good week to go to the beach. Update to follow later in the week. Following the recorder rotation list, Penelope will be the recorder, and Selina will help out as the deputy.

item.title: Recorder Rotation
item.description: Here’s the planned rotation for lab recorders and deputies (see Field Trip Instructions for an explanation and instructions): Sequence Recorder Deputy Actual Date 1 Penelope Selina Feb 8 2 Wayne Safiyah TBD 3 Nick Sean TBD 4 TBD TBD TBD (more rows to come!)

item.title: Feb 01 Lab
item.description: Plan Introductory presentation in our lab space, Gittleson 323. Then, outdoor walk around Hofstra campus to look for birds for up to 90 minutes. (Not going outside. Severe cold warnings. ) Special instructions If you have binoculars, please bring them. (If not, no problem.) Dress just to be outside at Hofstra, but warmly because it we will plan to be out for up to 90 minutes, and not always walking.

item.title: Field Trip Instructions
item.description: (This page may change.) We will go on a field trip nearly every Friday morning at 8. Usually we will ride in the van to one or two destinations less than 30 minutes away. We will normally return by 11 AM. Very occasionally, we might cut into class time, which immediately follows. Preparations in advance We will need your signed/filled-in permission form before you can go on any trips off campus.
